data.title: Claudiu Keșerü - Wikipedia
data.snippet:
Claudiu Andrei Keșerü (Romanian pronunciation: (/wiki/Help:IPA/Romanian "Help:IPA/Romanian"); born 2 December 1986) is a Romanian former professional footballer who played as a striker#Striker "Forward (association football)").

After starting out at his hometown side Bihor Oradea "FC Bihor Oradea (1958)"), Keșerü soon moved to Nantes in 2003. Over the course of nearly eleven years in France, he represented five clubs and amassed Ligue 1 and Ligue 2 totals of 240 appearances and 67 goals. In 2014, he returned to his native country by signing a contract with defending champions Steaua București. [...] |  |  |  |  |

| 2010 | → Angers (loan) | 14 | (4) | [...] Keșerü broke the club record for goals in a single game, scoring all six goals in a 6–0 win against Pandurii Târgu Jiu on 15 August 2014. The record was previously held by his coach, Constantin Gâlcă, who scored five times in a 5–0 victory over FC Brașov "FC Brașov (1936)") in 1994. It was the first time that a player scored six goals in a Liga I game since 9 June 1993, when Marian Popa of Farul Constanța accomplished the feat in a 6–3 success against Oțelul Galați. On 18 September 2014, in the first matchday of the Europa League group stage, a 6–0 win over Aalborg, Keșerü netted a hat-trick in just 12 minutes, between the 61st and 72nd minutes, resulting in the fastest hat-trick in the competition's history.

### Al-Gharafa

data.title: Claudiu Keșerü - Alchetron, The Free Social Encyclopedia
data.snippet:
On 28 October 2016, Keșerü scored his first hat-trick for Ludogorets in a First League match against Dunav Ruse. [...] Keșerü broke the club record for goals in a single game, scoring all six goals in a 6-0 win over Pandurii on 15 August 2014. The record was previously held by his coach, Constantin Gâlcă, who scored five times in a 5-0 win against FC Brașov in 1994. It was the first time that a player scored six goals in a Liga I game since 9 June 1993, when Marian Popa of Farul Constanța accomplished the feat in a 6-3 win over Oțelul Galați. In a 6-0 win over Aalborg BK in 2014–15 UEFA Europa League group round first matchday, on 18 September 2014, Keserü scored a hat-trick in just 12 minutes, between the 61st and 72nd minutes, resulting in the fastest hat-trick in UEFA Europa League history.

## Al-Gharafa [...] Keșerü then signed a three-year contract in August 2015 with Ludogorets Razgrad worth a gross annual value of €700,000 becoming the highest-paid player ever of The Eagles. In his first season at Ludogorets, the Romanian helped the team to win the championship, becoming its top goalscorer with 15 goals. Keșerü scored an equalizer against Red Star Belgrade in the first leg of third qualifying round of the 2016-17 UEFA Champions League, and then another equalizer in the second leg away match against Viktoria Plzeň in the play-off, helping his team to qualify for the group stage. He scored his maiden goal in the Champions League groups to give a 2-0 lead in the home match against Arsenal, but Ludogorets eventually lost by 2-3.
